taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek anagalao, to laugh, alluding to fabled power to alleviate sadness]

bio:treatment.discussion: Anagallis tenella (Linnaeus) Linnaeus, the European bog pimpernel, was reported in the late 1800s from Saint Pierre and Miquelon; it was most likely a waif and is not included here. It can be distinguished by its perennial habit, procumbent stems, and pink, funnelform corollas.
Anagallis foemina Miller, the European blue pimpernel, has been reported from western states; these reports are all based on blue-flowered forms of A. arvensis (see discussion there).

references.reference: Manns, U. and A. A. Anderberg. 2007. Character evolution in Anagallis (Myrsinaceae) inferred from morphological and molecular data. Syst. Bot. 32: 166–179.
